sentences.english: The fangs of surface humble, but the dog, full of greed narrow-minded.
sentences.chinese: 表面謙卑恭敬的大牙狗，實則心胸狹窄，充滿貪慾。

sentences.english: Nobody liked to make friends with a small-minded man.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人喜歡與一個心胸狹窄的人交朋友。

sentences.english: The intensely critical spirit is often the narrow-minded and ignorant one.
sentences.chinese: 極愛吹毛求疵的人往往是心胸狹窄和無知的人。

sentences.english: But it just seems petty not to give her one.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果我不送給她的話，又好象過於心胸狹窄了。

sentences.english: He was honest and upright, but conservative and narrow-minded.
sentences.chinese: 他誠實正直，但是保守，心胸狹窄。

sentences.english: That's the fault of the boss. He is too narrow-minded.
sentences.chinese: 完全是老闆的錯，他也太心胸狹窄了。

sentences.english: This office is peopled with petty-minded bureaucrats.
sentences.chinese: 這個辦事處到處是心胸狹窄的官僚。

sentences.english: Our boss is too narrow-minded to endure different opinions.
sentences.chinese: 我們老闆心胸狹窄，無法容忍不同看法。

sentences.english: Good looks can hide a selfish or mean-spirited personality.
sentences.chinese: 外表的好看可能隱藏着其自私和心胸狹窄的個性。

sentences.english: No first loves to do a friend dawn like a narrow-headed man.
sentences.chinese: 沒有人喜歡與這麼一個心胸狹窄的人交同學。

sentences.english: I threw a row of arrows, which narrowly passed the narrow-minded man’s eyebrows.
sentences.chinese: 我擲了一排箭，箭緊擦心胸狹窄的人的眉毛而過。

sentences.english: Small minded people to be sure.
sentences.chinese: 肯定都是些心胸狹窄的人。

sentences.english: No, she is stingy, narrow- minded and bossy.
sentences.chinese: 不，她小氣，心胸狹窄，又拔扈。

sentences.english: Originally I very am also mean-spirited.
sentences.chinese: 最初我非常上午並且心胸狹窄。

definition: lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
a clever person may become the victim of his own ingenuity (idiom); cleverness may overreach itself/too smart for one's own good
pinyin: cong1 ming2 fan3 bei4 cong1 ming2 wu4

definition: to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: not recognizing one's family (idiom); self-centered and not making any allowances for the needs of one's relatives
lit. Lord Ye's passion for dragons (idiom)/fig. to pretend to be fond of sth while actually fearing it/ostensible fondness of sth one really fears
